results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Presidential Election of 2024;United States Politics and Government;Elections, House of Representatives;Obama, Barack;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Trump, Donald J;Fetterman, John (1969- );Oz, Mehmet C;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Pennsylvania
results.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Michael C. Bender
results.title: 3 Presidents Swoop Into Pennsylvania, in a Clash That Transcends 2022
results.abstract: As the midterms come to a close, the establishment politics of the two most recent Democratic presidents met the disruptive force of the last Republican one, with control of Congress at stake.

media.caption: Lt. Gov. John Fetterman joined former President Barack Obama onstage in Pittsburgh on Saturday, alongside Mr. Fetterman’s wife, Gisele Barreto Fetterman.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Musk, Elon;Agrawal, Parag;King, Stephen;Twitter
results.title: On Twitter, Who Needs a Check Mark When You Can Have a Rat?
results.abstract: Elon Musk wants Twitter users to pay to be verified. An artist offers a wry alternative.

results.adx_keywords: Anti-Semitism;Basketball;Apologies;Irving, Kyrie;Durant, Kevin;Brooklyn Nets;National Basketball Assn
results.title: Nets Say Kyrie Irving’s Apology Isn’t Enough, and Nike Suspends Its Ties
results.abstract: Irving was suspended after he would not say he held no antisemitic beliefs. Nike suspended its relationship with him Friday.

media.caption: Until he was suspended Thursday, Nets guard Kyrie Irving had resisted calls to apologize for linking to an antisemitic film on Twitter.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Assaults;Kidnapping and Hostages;Midterm Elections (2022);Pelosi, Nancy;Pelosi, Paul;Depape, David;San Francisco (Calif)
results.title: Nancy Pelosi Says Her Husband’s Recovery Will Be a ‘Long Haul’
results.abstract: In her first publicly broadcast comments since her husband was injured by a hammer-wielding attacker, Ms. Pelosi said that “we have to be optimistic.”

media.caption: Speaker Nancy Pelosi outside her home in San Francisco on Friday.

results.adx_keywords: Missiles and Missile Defense Systems;Military Aircraft;United States International Relations;Defense and Military Forces;Kim Jong-un;North Korea;South Korea
results.title: North Korea Launches More Missiles, and U.S. Bombers Fly Over the South
results.abstract: Tensions further escalated on the divided peninsula, with Washington deploying supersonic B-1B bombers for the first time in years as part of a military exercise.

media.caption: Washington and Seoul participating in a joint military exercise over South Korea on Saturday in a photograph provided by the South Korean Defense Ministry.
media.copyright: South Korean Defense Ministry, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Child Abuse and Neglect;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Valva, Michael;Pollina, Angela;Valva, Thomas (d 2020);Long Island (NY);Center Moriches (NY)
results.title: Former New York Police Officer Convicted in Freezing Death of Son
results.abstract: The Long Island jury convicted Michael Valva of second-degree murder for killing his 8-year-old son, Thomas, who contracted hypothermia when he was made to stay in a freezing garage.

media.caption: Michael Valva, seen in a 2020 photo, was found guilty of second-degree murder and four counts of child endangerment.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);High Net Worth Individuals;United States Politics and Government;Campaign Finance;Political Advertising;Democracy (Theory and Philosophy);Bloomberg, Michael R;Griffin, Kenneth C;Mellon, Timothy (1942- );Soros, George;Uihlein, Richard
results.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and Rachel Shorey
results.title: Fueled by Billionaires, Political Spending Shatters Records Again
results.abstract: In the money race between America’s billionaires and small donors, the emerging political oligarchy is showing staying power. Both parties have megadonors, but Republicans have far more.

media.caption: Samuel Bankman-Fried is the Democrat who made arguably the biggest splash for his party. His $37 million in giving helped fund the Democrats’ two main super PACs.
media.copyright: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Music;Deaths (Obituaries);Pop and Rock Music;Children and Childhood;Aaron Carter;Backstreet Boys;Los Angeles (Calif)
results.byline: By Melina Delkic and McKenna Oxenden
results.title: Aaron Carter, Singer and Onetime Teenage Sensation, Dies at 34
results.abstract: Mr. Carter, who released his first album at age 9 and “Aaron’s Party” at age 12, was the younger brother of Nick Carter, a member of the Backstreet Boys.

media.caption: Aaron Carter in 2012. He released five studio albums and was a contestant on the show “Dancing With the Stars.”

results.adx_keywords: Layoffs and Job Reductions;Social Media;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Computers and the Internet;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Kate Conger, Ryan Mac and Mike Isaac
results.title: Confusion and Frustration Reign as Elon Musk Cuts Half of Twitter’s Staff
results.abstract: The layoffs hit across many divisions, including the engineering and machine learning units, the teams that manage content moderation, and the sales and advertising departments.

media.caption: On Friday morning, at least nine security guards were seen patrolling Twitter headquarters in San Francisco. Employees had been told to stay home as layoffs were carried out.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Illegal Immigration;United States Politics and Government;Assaults;Depape, David;Pelosi, Paul;Pelosi, Nancy;Homeland Security Department;Immigration and Customs Enforcement (US);Canada
results.title: Suspect in Pelosi Attack Was in the U.S. Illegally, Officials Say
results.abstract: David DePape, a Canadian, legally entered the United States in 2008. He faces several state and federal charges after the authorities say he broke into Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home and assaulted her husband.

media.caption: Police officers outside Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home in San Francisco last week.

results.adx_keywords: Synagogues;Anti-Semitism;Federal Bureau of Investigation;New Jersey
results.byline: By Tracey Tully and Shlomo Schorr
results.title: F.B.I. Locates Suspect After Warning of Security Threat at New Jersey Synagogues
results.abstract: Officials said the man holds “radical extremist views.” On Thursday, they had alerted congregations across the state to be on alert.

media.caption: Police officers stand watch outside the United Synagogue of Hoboken, N.J., on Thursday.

results.title: New Covid Variants Are Circulating. Here’s What to Know.
results.abstract: The “nightmare variant” is not as bad as it sounds.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Midterm Elections (2022);Winfrey, Oprah
results.byline: By Trip Gabriel and Katie Glueck
results.title: Oprah Winfrey Supports Fetterman Over Oz in Pennsylvania’s Senate Race
results.abstract: Ms. Winfrey was instrumental in the rise of Dr. Mehmet Oz, the celebrity television doctor and Republican Senate nominee, but she has announced her support for John Fetterman, his Democratic opponent.

media.caption: Oprah Winfrey said she would have already voted for Lt. Gov. John Fetterman during a virtual midterms-focused event late Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, House of Representatives;Political Advertising;United States Politics and Government;Harrigan, Pat (1987- );Jackson, Jeff (1982- );Republican Party;Democratic Party;North Carolina
results.title: House Candidate Drops Ad in North Carolina After Report of Bullet Hole
results.abstract: After news belatedly broke that a Republican congressional candidate’s parents had found a bullet hole at their home, the Democrat in the race pulled an ad showing a different residence belonging to his opponent.

media.caption: A photo provided by the campaign of Pat Harrigan, a Republican running for an open House seat in North Carolina, shows a bullet hole in a window in the laundry room of his parents’ home.

results.byline: By Mike Isaac and Ryan Mac
results.title: Elon Musk, Under Financial Pressure, Pushes to Make Money From Twitter
results.abstract: The billionaire and his advisers have discussed adding paid direct messages, fees to watch videos and other features to the service.

media.caption: Twitter’s headquarters in San Francisco. Last year, the company had less money in cash flow than what it now owes its lenders annually.

results.title: Medicare Advantage or Just Medicare?
results.abstract: It’s annual enrollment season once again. Here’s a look at the pros and cons of the two approaches to health insurance.

results.adx_keywords: Weddings and Engagements;Memphis (Tenn)
results.title: ‘Still Growing Together,’ a Teenage Crush Leads to Marriage
results.abstract: Brittney Adu was smitten when she saw Aaron Canales on the first day of their freshman year of high school. Despite their cultural differences and the trials of a young romance, their love endured.

media.caption: Brittney Adu said she felt like the “president of the entire world” when Aaron Canales asked her to be his girlfriend in 2013. The couple married Sept. 17 at the Lichterman Nature Center in Memphis.
media.copyright: Whitten Sabbatini for The New York Times

results.title: The Company Once Known as Restoration Hardware Is Opening Restaurants. Why?
results.abstract: The furnishings store has moved into the hospitality business — but the food may not be the point.

media.caption: The home-design company RH has opened 15 restaurants across the United States and Canada since 2015.
